availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse Despain (Green County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Silas Despain and Abigail Despain. Resident in Green County in 1850. Farm hand in Green County in 1860. Served in 13th Kentucky Infantry Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as third sergeant, second sergeant, first sergeant, and first lieutenant from October 29, 1861 to January 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District no. 2, p. 136.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District no. 1, p. 683.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Randolph County, p. 362.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 264.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 866.
Find A Grave, "Jesse H. Despain (unknown-1910)," Memorial #31825540, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/31825540 (accessed August 13, 2018).
